title: Fix horizontal relationship line alignment in issue list
description: Fixed horizontal relationship lines in the React issue list to align with row centers instead of being hardcoded to 20px offset. Changed centerY calculation from `rect.top - containerRect.top + 20` to `rect.top - containerRect.top + rect.height / 2` to match the original HTML implementation.

title: Extract utility functions from IssueList into taskUtils.ts

comments.author: agent
comments.content:
Successfully extracted utility functions from the monolithic IssueList React component into separate, reusable modules.

**What was extracted:**
- **taskUtils.ts** (~80 lines): Pure utility functions for task operations
- **types.ts** (~20 lines): Shared TypeScript interfaces

**Functions moved to taskUtils.ts:**
- `createTypeBadge()` - Creates badge info for task types
- `createStatusPill()` - Creates pill info for task status
- `createPriorityPill()` - Creates pill info for task priority  
- `isReady()` - Checks if task has no blocking dependencies
- `isBlocked()` - Checks if task is blocked by dependencies
- `getStatusIcon()` - Returns icon character for status
- `getStatusLabel()` - Returns display label for status

**Types moved to types.ts:**
- `Issue` interface - Complete task/issue data structure
- `IssueListProps` interface - Component props (extensible)

**Benefits:**
- **Reduced** IssueList.tsx from ~450 lines to ~350 lines
- **Improved** reusability - utility functions can be used by other components
- **Better** separation of concerns - pure functions separated from component logic
- **Enhanced** maintainability - centralized type definitions
- **Preserved** all existing functionality and behavior

This continues the incremental refactoring approach, making the codebase more modular and maintainable.

title: Extract custom hooks from IssueList component

comments.author: agent
comments.content:
Successfully extracted custom hooks from the monolithic IssueList React component, dramatically improving code organization and testability.

**Hooks Created:**
- **`useVSCodeMessaging`** (~15 lines): Handles VS Code API communication and message posting
- **`useTaskState`** (~35 lines): Manages all task-related state (tasks, filters, expanded items, toggles)
- **`useTaskInteractions`** (~80 lines): Handles task action functions and dropdown state management
- **`useTaskFiltering`** (~15 lines): Pure filtering logic with memoization
- **`useTaskHierarchy`** (~35 lines): Tree building algorithm with memoization

**What Was Extracted:**
- VS Code API initialization and messaging
- All state management (6 useState hooks consolidated)
- Task interaction functions (start, complete, edit, create, delete)
- Dropdown/popover state and outside click handling
- Filtering logic with dependency checking
- Hierarchy building algorithm
- Message event handling

**Benefits:**
- **Dramatically reduced** IssueList.tsx from ~350 lines to ~50 lines
- **Improved testability** - each hook can be tested in isolation
- **Enhanced reusability** - hooks can be used by other components
- **Better separation of concerns** - logic separated from presentation
- **Easier maintenance** - focused, single-responsibility hooks

**IssueList.tsx Now:**
- Pure presentation component focused on rendering
- Uses composition of custom hooks
- Much more readable and maintainable
- Follows React best practices for custom hooks

This represents a major architectural improvement, transforming a monolithic component into a well-structured, hook-based architecture.
